## Description {#details}

Representation of the alloca slices.

This class represents the slices of an alloca which are formed by its various uses. If a pointer escapes, we can&#39;t fully build a representation for the slices used and we reflect that in this structure. The uses are stored, sorted by increasing beginning offset and with unsplittable slices starting at a particular offset before splittable slices.

Definition at line 594 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.

### getDeadOperands() {#a9573d85afd3de8ebbfa0999ba6edcb7e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ArrayRef&lt; Use &#42; &gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::getDeadOperands () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Access the dead operands referring to this alloca.

These are operands which have cannot actually be used to refer to the alloca as they are outside its range and the user doesn&#39;t correct for that. These mostly consist of PHI node inputs and the like which we just need to replace with undef.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00656">656</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### insert() {#a9d50c642270c265bdb2af02bf6d4eed0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::insert (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-sroa-cpp-/slice">Slice</a> &gt; NewSlices)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Insert new slices for this alloca.

This moves the slices into the alloca&#39;s slices collection, and re-sorts everything so that the usual ordering properties of the alloca&#39;s slices hold.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00629">629</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.

### isEscaped() {#a4b26ec50bd45cb91a28d19e08b53e6be}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::isEscaped () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Test whether a pointer to the allocation escapes our analysis.

If this is true, the slices are never fully built and should be ignored.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00603">603</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.

## Private Member Attributes

### AI {#a87b8b1a7991dc517107257e9cf1b39cb}

Handle to alloca instruction to simplify method interfaces.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00677">677</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### DeadOperands {#a4ad91690cafe0701596a82d775af4adf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;Use &#42;, 8&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::DeadOperands</>}>
Operands which will become dead if we rewrite the alloca.

These are operands that in their particular use can be replaced with poison when we rewrite the alloca. These show up in out-of-bounds inputs to PHI nodes and the like. They aren&#39;t entirely dead (there might be a GEP back into the bounds using it elsewhere) and nor is the PHI, but we want to swap this particular input for poison to simplify the use lists of the alloca.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00716">716</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### DeadUseIfPromotable {#afe92405fd1ec0e339c21f43389b594a8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;Use &#42;, 8&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::DeadUseIfPromotable</>}>
Uses which will become dead if can promote the alloca.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00706">706</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### DeadUsers {#a3d9d55bb31a2f1703622a919c022b9d3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 8&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::DeadUsers</>}>
Instructions which will become dead if we rewrite the alloca.

Note that these are not separated by slice. This is because we expect an alloca to be completely rewritten or not rewritten at all. If rewritten, all these instructions can simply be removed and replaced with poison as they come from outside of the allocated space.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00703">703</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### PointerEscapingInstr {#ae6a95bb5e149d475832e1861abcd6282}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Instruction&#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::PointerEscapingInstr</>}>
The instruction responsible for this alloca not having a known set of slices.

When an instruction (potentially) escapes the pointer to the alloca, we store a pointer to that here and abort trying to form slices of the alloca. This will be null if the alloca slices are analyzed successfully.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00686">686</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Instruction&#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::PointerEscapingInstrReadOnly</>}>

</MemberDefinition>

### Slices {#aa8c5ab4b0842010c56bfe122541038bb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;Slice, 8&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SROA.cpp&#125;::AllocaSlices::Slices</>}>
The slices of the alloca.

We store a vector of the slices formed by uses of the alloca here. This vector is sorted by increasing begin offset, and then the unsplittable slices before the splittable ones. See the <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-sroa-cpp-/slice">Slice</a> inner class for more details.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp/#l00695">695</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/sroa-cpp">SROA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
